verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> of Tyre. <WH6865> Howl, <WH3213> ye ships <WH591> of Tarshish; <WH8659> for <WH3588> it is laid waste, <WH7703> so that there is no house, <WH4480> <WH1004> no entering in: <WH4480> <WH935> from the land <WH4480> <WH776> of Chittim <WH3794> it is revealed <WH1540> to them.
Be still, <WH1826> ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the isle; <WH339> thou whom the merchants <WH5503> of Zidon, <WH6721> that pass over <WH5674> the sea, <WH3220> have replenished. <WH4390>

And by great <WH7227> waters <WH4325> the seed <WH2233> of Sihor, <WH7883> the harvest <WH7105> of the river, <WH2975> is her revenue; <WH8393> and she is <WH1961> a mart <WH5505> of nations. <WH1471>

Be thou ashamed, <WH954> O Zidon: <WH6721> for <WH3588> the sea <WH3220> hath spoken, <WH559> even the strength <WH4581> of the sea, <WH3220> saying, <WH559> I travail <WH2342> not, <WH3808> nor <WH3808> bring forth children, <WH3205> neither <WH3808> do I nourish up <WH1431> young men, <WH970> nor bring up <WH7311> virgins. <WH1330>
As <WH834> at the report <WH8088> concerning Egypt, <WH4714> so shall they be sorely pained <WH2342> at the report <WH8088> of Tyre. <WH6865>
Pass ye over <WH5674> to Tarshish; <WH8659> howl, <WH3213> ye inhabitants <WH3427> of the isle. <WH339>

Is this <WH2063> your joyous <WH5947> city, whose antiquity <WH6927> is of ancient <WH6924> days? <WH4480> <WH3117> her own feet <WH7272> shall carry <WH2986> her afar off <WH4480> <WH7350> to sojourn. <WH1481>

Who <WH4310> hath taken this counsel <WH3289> <WH2063> against <WH5921> Tyre, <WH6865> the crowning <WH5849> city, whose <WH834> merchants <WH5503> are princes, <WH8269> whose traders <WH3669> are the honorable <WH3513> of the earth? <WH776>

The LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> hath purposed <WH3289> it, to stain <WH2490> the pride <WH1347> of all <WH3605> glory, <WH6643> and to bring into contempt <WH7043> all <WH3605> the honorable <WH3513> of the earth. <WH776>
Pass through <WH5674> thy land <WH776> as a river, <WH2975> O daughter <WH1323> of Tarshish: <WH8659> there is no <WH369> more <WH5750> strength. <WH4206>

He stretched out <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> over <WH5921> the sea, <WH3220> he shook <WH7264> the kingdoms: <WH4467> the LORD <WH3068> hath given a commandment <WH6680> against <WH413> the merchant <WH3667> city, to destroy <WH8045> the strongholds <WH4581> thereof.

And he said, <WH559> Thou shalt no <WH3808> more <WH5750> rejoice, <WH5937> O thou oppressed <WH6231> virgin, <WH1330> daughter <WH1323> of Zidon: <WH6721> arise, <WH6965> pass over <WH5674> to Chittim; <WH3794> there <WH8033> also <WH1571> shalt thou have no rest. <WH5117> <WH3808>

Behold <WH2005> the land <WH776> of the Chaldeans; <WH3778> this <WH2088> people <WH5971> was <WH1961> not, <WH3808> till the Assyrian <WH804> founded <WH3245> it for them that dwell in the wilderness: <WH6728> they set up <WH6965> the towers <WH971> thereof, they raised up <WH6209> the palaces <WH759> thereof; and he brought <WH7760> it to ruin. <WH4654>
Howl, <WH3213> ye ships <WH591> of Tarshish: <WH8659> for <WH3588> your strength <WH4581> is laid waste. <WH7703>

And it shall come to pass <WH1961> in that <WH1931> day, <WH3117> that Tyre <WH6865> shall be forgotten <WH7911> seventy <WH7657> years, <WH8141> according to the days <WH3117> of one <WH259> king: <WH4428> after the end <WH4480> <WH7093> of seventy <WH7657> years <WH8141> shall Tyre <WH6865> sing <WH7892> as a harlot. <WH2181>

Take <WH3947> a harp, <WH3658> go about <WH5437> the city, <WH5892> thou harlot <WH2181> that hast been forgotten; <WH7911> make sweet <WH3190> melody, <WH5059> sing many <WH7235> songs, <WH7892> that <WH4616> thou mayest be remembered. <WH2142>

And it shall come to pass <WH1961> after the end <WH4480> <WH7093> of seventy <WH7657> years, <WH8141> that the LORD <WH3068> will visit <WH6485> <WH853> Tyre, <WH6865> and she shall turn <WH7725> to her hire, <WH868> and shall commit fornication <WH2181> with <WH854> all <WH3605> the kingdoms <WH4467> of the world <WH776> upon <WH5921> the face <WH6440> of the earth. <WH127>

And her merchandise <WH5504> and her hire <WH868> shall be <WH1961> holiness <WH6944> to the LORD: <WH3068> it shall not <WH3808> be treasured <WH686> nor <WH3808> laid up; <WH2630> for <WH3588> her merchandise <WH5504> shall be <WH1961> for them that dwell <WH3427> before <WH6440> the LORD, <WH3068> to eat <WH398> sufficiently, <WH7654> and for durable <WH6266> clothing. <WH4374>
